text: idea: i would like to have the ability to choose another image with a different aspect ratio for mobile.
you could build that into your custom module, you just need 2 image fields

because the blog post field has been recommended again, I want to reiterate an idea that has long been requested.

It’d be nice to have 1 field for links that can link to a page, a custom text link, or a post. with optional fields that can be enabled for “open in new tab” and if you want to feel fancy an optional field for “download”

That field would allow you to disable/enable the type of links it directly supported, so if you didn’t want to allow a custom typed link, or didn’t want to include posts, or didn’t want to include pages you’d just toggle them off.

This 1 field would solve a big UX/UI problem we currently have and give users a more consistent experience.

Many of us are currently faking this sort of UI by using conditional fields, and it’s not pretty and makes it tedious.

we are currently working on a link field now with different options for what type of link to select (page, custom text, etc.). At the moment this field won't yet have the ability to control which type of link it supports but we are considering ways to let devs configure which parts of a field are shown in a way that doesnt mean we have to add properties to every single field type for every single property of a field manually

just because I haven’t suggested it in a couple weeks but still would love it.

<https://emmet.io/>

Please add this to the code editor

There’s already a version of it for codemirror

Obviously most editors dont have to deal with hubl but it does say support is as simple as adding the script tag right after the code mirror script then you either require it in code mirror.
I agree, i find myself writing alot of my code in sublime text and then pasting it over into the modules

after reading the documentation for emmet. I might try building this into the extension tonight. I can’t make any garuntees because it has to play well with HubSpot’s javascript :shrug: and it may not be stable enough
Has anyone used HubSpot CMS to host a virtual event? Think: keynotes, breakout rooms/sessions but all online.
<@UAGGE6R16> the new zoom integration could be good to use for this?
Possibly. I’m wondering if it just makes more sense to use a standalone SaaS product that does it all, or if I’m overcomplicating things.
I'd say it'd depend how close a dataflow you'd like to get into HubSpot, might be trickier with standalone though some will have zapier integrations that could be used
